title: Long Way to the Top – AC/DC
credit_line: ℗ 1976 J. Albert & Sons Pty Ltd. (Young / Scott / Young)
brief_description: The music video for AC/DC’s hit that featured the ban travelling down Melbourne’s Swanston street on the back of a truck, which helped lead to the band having a laneway named after them.

constellations_primary.name: The secret life of suburbia and music videos
constellations_primary.description: Australia's famous streets and suburbs have defined music videos, TV shows and miniseries, providing a unique backdrop to Australian stories and music.

description: Countdown (1974–87) was not only one of the first television programs in the world to regularly play music videos, but it also created clips for local acts such as It’s A Long Way To The Top (1976) for AC/DC. The footage of the band travelling down Melbourne’s Swanston Street on the back of a truck as they perform live became so iconic, it led to the city naming a key piece of geography after them in 2004: ACDC Lane.
description_for_label: Countdown (1974–87) was not only one of the first television programs in the world to regularly play music videos, but it also created clips for local acts such as It’s A Long Way To The Top (1976) for AC/DC. The footage of the band travelling down Melbourne’s Swanston Street on the back of a truck as they perform live became so iconic, it led to the city naming a key piece of geography after them in 2004: ACDC Lane.
